alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 9:18PM MST until August 23 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 1115 PM MST. * At 918 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across central Cochise county, with the heaviest rainfall near Pearce-Sunsites and Sunizona. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially along and near Ash, Stanford and Turkey creeks. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pearce-Sunsites, Elfrida and Sunizona. This includes the following streams and drainages... Pridham Creek, Ash Creek, Witch Creek, Fivemile Creek, Stanford Creek, Turkey Creek and Whitewater Draw. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
